<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Loss on remeasurement of equity method investment
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In fiscal 2015, we recognized a&#160;$1.5 million&#160;loss on remeasurement of our equity method investment in Blue Mountain in connection with the Blue Mountain Acquisition. There were no comparable transactions in either fiscal 2016 or fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest income
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The decrease in interest income in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year was primarily due to the closing of the IRCG Transaction in January 2016, which resulted in us no longer recording the interest income from IRCG's financing activities. The decrease in interest income in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year was primarily due to a decrease in IRCG interest income as a result of a decline in the average outstanding IRCG long-term receivables balance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest expense on third party debt
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest expense on third party debt decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal 2015 due to the repricing of our Senior Debt in April 2015, which lowered the average annual effective rate from approximately 5.5% to approximately 4.75%. Additionally, in fiscal 2016 we reduced the outstanding principal balance of the Term Loan due to an excess cash flow prepayment of $8.8 million paid in January 2016 and a $25.0 million principal repayment in April 2016 in conjunction with executing the Fourth Amendment. These decreases were partially offset by an increase in the average annual effective rate from approximately 4.75% to 5.00% as part of the Fourth Amendment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest expense on third party debt decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	as a result of refinancing our senior debt facilities in December 2013, which lowered the average annual effective interest rate from approximately 9.0% to approximately 5.5% and reduced the average outstanding principal balance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest expense on notes payable to affiliates
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The decrease in interest expense on notes payable to affiliates in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal 2014 was due to the Restructuring in December 2013, which resulted in notes payable to affiliates, including accrued and unpaid interest, either exchanged for our common stock or canceled, or pursuant to which our subsidiaries were released from their obligations, including guarantor obligations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Earnings (loss) from equity method investments
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The earnings from equity method investments in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the loss in the prior fiscal year was primarily a result of earnings from our investments in the Mammoth family of resorts. In March 2015, the Mammoth family of resorts added Snow Summit Mountain Resort and Bear Mountain. The Mammoth family of resorts experienced an increase in Skier Visits (as defined below) driven by improved snowfall and better ski conditions compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The increase in the loss from equity method investments in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year was primarily a result of acquiring the remaining 50.0% equity interest in Blue Mountain that we did not already own on September 19, 2014 and, therefore, no longer accounting for Blue Mountain as an equity method investment. The loss from equity method investments in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	includes Blue Mountain's results for the entire fiscal year, including the peak ski season, in which Blue Mountain experienced operating income, whereas the loss from equity method investments in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	only includes Blue Mountain's results for a portion of the first quarter, in which Blue Mountain experienced operating losses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Loss on extinguishment of debt
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, we recognized a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	loss on extinguishment of debt as a result of amending our Senior Debt in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015. In fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, we recognized a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$35.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	loss on extinguishment of debt as a result of refinancing our senior debt facilities in December 2013. There was no comparable transaction in fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other income (expense), net
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$3.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year primarily due to a favorable legacy legal settlement partially offset by approximately $1.7 million of foreign currency transaction losses. Other expense, net, increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.2 million

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income tax expense (benefit)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-BOTTOM: 13PX; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In fiscal 2016, we recognized $1.8 million of tax expense related to tax paying entities primarily in Canada. The $3.9 million tax benefit for fiscal 2015 was primarily attributable to our restructuring of the wholly owned interest in Blue Mountain subsequent to the Blue Mountain Acquisition. This benefit was partially offset by income tax expense related to tax paying entities primarily in Canada. The resulting effective tax rates were 4.0% and 43.4% in fiscal 2016 and 2015, respectively. The effective tax rate in fiscal 2016 and 2015 differs from the federal blended statutory rate of 28.2% and 23.5%, respectively, due to changes in recorded valuation allowances for entities in the United States and Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-BOTTOM: 13PX; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The $0.7 million tax expense for fiscal 2014 was the result of tax paying entities primarily in Canada. The resulting effective tax rate for fiscal 2014 was (0.4)%. The effective tax rate in fiscal 2014 differs from the federal blended statutory rate of 27.8% due to changes in recorded valuation allowances for entities in the United States and Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A ID="SF20F070F55B6599D96D7177D110FB04B" NAME="FORM10K_HTM_SF20F070F55B6599D96D7177D110FB04B">
</A>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID">

<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	112,700
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	101,194
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	See "Non-GAAP Financial Measures" below for reconciliations between non-GAAP financial measures and the most directly comparable GAAP (as defined below) measures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A ID="S0ECBD2A28A32531DBA23F3B6C8B8B9B6" NAME="FORM10K_HTM_S0ECBD2A28A32531DBA23F3B6C8B8B9B6">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Mountain
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue and Mountain Adjusted EBITDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Mountain segment earns revenue from a variety of business activities conducted at our mountain resorts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Lift revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lift revenue is derived from a variety of lift pass products, including multi-resort and single-resort passes, season pass products, frequency card products of varying durations and single and multi-day lift tickets. Our season pass products, including our multi-resort products, are predominately sold prior to the start of the ski season. Season pass revenue, although primarily collected prior to each ski season, is recognized in our consolidated financial statements during such fiscal year based on the prior three-year average pass product usage patterns. Frequency product revenue is recognized based on usage, and revenue on unused products is recognized based on the prior three-year average usage for each frequency product. During the summer season, Lift revenue primarily relates to mountain biking and sightseeing lift products.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Lodging revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lodging revenue is derived primarily from our management of rental programs for condominium properties located at or in close proximity to our mountain resorts. We typically receive 25% to 50% of the daily room revenue, with the condominium owners receiving the remaining share. We also earn lodging revenue from hotel properties we own at Winter Park, Stratton and Snowshoe.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Ski School revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ski School revenue is derived from our operation of ski and ride schools at each of our mountain resorts. We are the exclusive provider of these services at each of our resorts. During the summer season, Ski School revenue is derived from mountain bike instruction and child care.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Retail and Rental revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Retail and Rental revenue is derived from the rental of ski, snowboard and bike equipment and the sale of ski, snowboard and bike accessories, equipment, apparel, logo wear, gifts and sundries at our on-mountain and base area outlets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; PADDING-LEFT: 0PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 10PX">
<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="Z51495E0CB9AE44AD9FE0FF8D549B1B8B" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
</TR>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	39
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; PADDING-LEFT: 0PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 10PX">
<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="Z1530CE54A4DD46A790CC5351E12D7D02" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_S47885D5B724D5B4C834EAE62A5B94346">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Food and Beverage revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Food and Beverage revenue is derived from our operation of restaurants, bars and other food and beverage outlets at our resorts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Other revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other revenue is derived from fees earned through a wide variety of activities and ancillary operations, including private clubs, municipal services, call centers, parking operations, golf, summer base area activities, sponsorships, entertainment events and other resort activities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Mountain Adjusted EBITDA.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (&#8220;EBITDA&#8221;) is Mountain revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	less
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain operating expenses, adjusted for our pro rata share of EBITDA for our equity method investment in Blue Mountain for all periods prior to our acquisition of the remaining 50.0% interest in September 2014. Mountain operating expenses include: wages, incentives and benefits for resort personnel; direct costs of food, beverage and retail inventory; general and administrative expenses; and resort operating expenses, such as contract services, utilities, fuel, permit and lease payments, credit card fees, property taxes, and maintenance and operating supplies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Key Business Metrics Evaluated by Management
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Skier Visits
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We measure visitation volume during the ski season, which is when most of our lift revenue is earned, by the number of &#8220;Skier Visits&#8221; at our resorts, each of which represents an individual&#8217;s use of a paid or complimentary ticket, frequency card or season pass product to ski or snowboard at our mountain resorts for any part of one day. The number of Skier Visits, viewed in conjunction with ETP, is an important indicator of our Lift revenue. Changes in the number of Skier Visits have an impact on Mountain revenue. The number of Skier Visits is affected by numerous factors, including the quality of the guest experience, the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, pricing policies, snow and weather conditions, overall industry trends, macroeconomic factors and the relative attractiveness of our resort offerings compared to competitive offerings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue per Visit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue per Visit is defined as total Mountain revenue recorded during the ski season divided by total Skier Visits during such period. For each fiscal year, this means total Mountain revenue as used in this calculation only includes revenue from November 1st through April 30th. This metric excludes non-ski season revenue, which is not directly correlated to skier visit growth. Revenue per Visit is influenced by our mix of guests. Destination guests are more likely to purchase ancillary products and services than regional guests and a higher percentage of destination guests in our skier mix typically increases Revenue per Visit.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	ETP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Effective ticket price, or "ETP", is defined as Lift revenue recorded during the ski season divided by total Skier Visits. For each fiscal year, this means total Mountain revenue as used in this calculation only includes revenue from November 1st through April 30th. ETP is influenced by lift product mix and other factors. Season pass products offer unlimited access, subject to certain exceptions and restrictions, for a fixed upfront payment. As a result, season passholders skiing more frequently in a given fiscal period as compared to the corresponding prior year period will result in downward pressure on ETP. This downward pressure on ETP is more pronounced in ski seasons with higher snowfall, as season pass holders increase their usage. Conversely, single and multi-day lift ticket products are priced per visit, and therefore a greater proportion of use of these products will tend to increase our ETP. Other factors that influence ETP include the number of complimentary or special promotional passes issued by us, the average age of skiers visiting our resorts, the volume of group or promotional sales and the relative volume of products sold through different sales channels, including our call centers, our ecommerce platform and our network of third-party online and traditional travel companies. Products sold at the ticket counter, which has been a declining percentage of Lift revenue in recent years, are typically priced higher relative to other channels because walk-up customers are our least price sensitive guests.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue per available room
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RevPAR
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	is determined by dividing gross room revenue during a given period by the number of units available to guests during such period.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Average Daily Rate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	"ADR"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	is determined by dividing gross room revenue during a given period by the number of occupied units under management during such period. ADR is a measure commonly used in the lodging industry, as well as by our management to track lodging pricing trends. ADR trends provide useful information concerning the pricing environment and the nature of the customer base of a lodging operation. ADR is affected by numerous factors, including the quality of the guest experience, the effectiveness of our marketing efforts, snow and weather conditions, overall industry trends, macroeconomic factors and the relative attractiveness of our resort offerings compared to competing offerings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; PADDING-LEFT: 0PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 10PX">
<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="Z9FD220576B9049B0A584954904304249" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	40
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; OVERFLOW: HIDDEN">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; PADDING-LEFT: 0PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 10PX">
<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="Z7DE78A22C7014B9B838B8D3BE9E0D7C6" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain revenue decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;primarily due to&#160;an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$14.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	. Excluding the foreign currency adjustment, Mountain revenue increased&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$10.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal 2015. The increase was primarily attributable to owning Blue Mountain for the entire fiscal 2016 period whereas Mountain revenue in fiscal 2015 only included Blue Mountain revenue subsequent to the Acquisition Date. Prior to the Acquisition Date, Blue Mountain was accounted for under the equity method and therefore the associated revenue was not included in Mountain revenue. Excluding the foreign currency adjustment and Blue Mountain, Mountain revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	0.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, due to a 10% increase in revenue at our Colorado resorts partially offset by a 9.0% decrease in revenue at our Eastern resorts due to unprecedented warm weather during the 2015/2016 ski season.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$7.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Mountain revenue increased&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$24.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	7.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;primarily due to increases in season pass and frequency product revenue, Ski School revenue and other guest services revenue compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lift revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lift revenue decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$4.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	. Excluding the foreign currency adjustment, Lift revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, primarily due to higher revenue at our Colorado resorts driven by increased season pass sales and increased pricing on paid tickets. Season pass and frequency product revenue for the 2015/2016 ski season increased 5.6% compared to the prior fiscal year and comprised
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	43.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	40.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	of Lift revenue in fiscal 2016 and 2015, respectively. Season pass revenue, for which cash is generally collected prior to the ski season, is recognized based on historical usage patterns. Frequency product revenue is recognized as used, and unused portions ("breakage") are recognized based on historical usage patterns for each frequency product. During the summer season, Lift revenue primarily relates to mountain biking and sightseeing products, which increased in fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015 primarily due to higher summer visitation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lift revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Lift revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$13.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	9.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;compared to the prior fiscal year primarily due to a 14.2% increase in season pass and frequency product sales across our resorts, select price increases primarily at our Colorado resorts and modest skier visit growth. Excluding Blue Mountain, season pass and frequency product revenue comprised 39.9% and 37.5% of Lift revenue for fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; PADDING-LEFT: 0PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 10PX">
<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="Z150B002806DC4074B5C36F330FA6AF5B" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lodging revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lodging revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain during all of fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which only included revenue from Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Lodging revenue decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year. The decrease was primarily due to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	7.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	decrease in revenue at our Eastern resorts driven by a 9.4% decrease in room nights, which was partially offset by a 12.9% increase in lodging revenue at our Colorado resorts due to higher ADR and a 4.9% increase in room nights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Lodging revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Lodging revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year primarily due to higher RevPAR at Tremblant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ski School revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ski School revenue decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;a decrease in Skier Visits at our Eastern resorts. Ski School revenue decreased 20.8% at our Eastern resorts, partially offset by an increase in Ski School revenue of 4.1% at our Colorado resorts. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Ski School revenue decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015. During the summer season, Ski School revenue is derived from mountain bike instruction and child care, which increased slightly in fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ski School revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Ski School revenue increased&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	9.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2015 compared to the prior fiscal year due to a higher yield per Skier Visit offset slightly by decreases in mountain bike instruction and child care revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Retail and Rental revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Retail and Rental revenue decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to a 14.2% decrease in Retail and Rental revenue at our Eastern resorts as a result of decreased retail sales and rental volume attributable to the unprecedented warm weather during the 2015/2016 ski season. The decrease at our Eastern resorts was partially offset by a 9.6% increase at our Colorado resorts driven by higher retail and rental sales from strong summer visitation and higher retail sales due to snowy conditions during the 2015/2016 ski season and the positive impact of owning Blue Mountain for all of fiscal 2016. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Retail and Rental revenue decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2016 compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Retail and Rental revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Retail and Rental revenue increased&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$4.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	10.8%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, compared to the prior fiscal year primarily due to select price increases, increased retail sales volume in the East due to periods of unusually cold weather, an increase in mountain bike rentals and sales and successful summer liquidation sales.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Food and Beverage revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Food and Beverage revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to higher Revenue per Visit at our Colorado resorts and the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain during all of fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which only included results of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date, partially offset by decreases in Food and Beverage revenue at our Eastern resorts. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Food and Beverage revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	0.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015 driven by higher revenue at our Colorado resorts, higher summer visitation and an increase in group business revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Food and Beverage revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Food and Beverage revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2015 compared to the prior fiscal year due to an increase in yield per Skier Visit and an increase in weddings and banquets, primarily at our Colorado resorts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 48PX; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain during all of fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which only included results of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Other revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	0.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; PADDING-LEFT: 48PX; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other revenue increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to&#160;the inclusion of revenue from owning 100% of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and an unfavorable foreign currency adjustment of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, Other revenue decreased&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain Adjusted EBITDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain Adjusted EBITDA decreased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$4.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	decrease in Mountain revenue, partially offset by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	decrease in Mountain operating expenses. The decrease in Mountain operating expenses from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$337.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$337.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	was primarily due to a favorable foreign currency adjustment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$13.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	partially offset by the inclusion of 100% of Blue Mountain during all of fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015, which only included results of Blue Mountain since the Acquisition Date. Prior to the Acquisition Date, Blue Mountain was accounted for under the equity method and, therefore, the associated operating expenses were not included in Mountain operating expenses. Mountain Adjusted EBITDA in the prior year period included $0.3 million of our pro rata share of EBITDA from Blue Mountain for the period from July 1, 2014 through the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and unfavorable foreign currency adjustments, Mountain revenue increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	0.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal 2016, partially offset by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	0.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, increase in Mountain operating expenses, resulting in an increase to Mountain Adjusted EBITDA of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mountain Adjusted EBITDA increased in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	compared to fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	primarily due to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$75.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	increase in Mountain revenue, partially offset by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$55.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	increase in Mountain operating expenses. The increase in Mountain operating expenses from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$281.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$337.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	was primarily due to the inclusion of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$44.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	of Blue Mountain operating expenses as well as increases in staffing at our resorts, health and medical coverage expense, compensation expense, and higher IT service costs. In fiscal 2015, Mountain operating expenses included 100% of Blue Mountain's operating expenses subsequent to the Acquisition Date, whereas prior to the Blue Mountain Acquisition, Blue Mountain was accounted for under the equity method. In fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;Mountain Adjusted EBITDA included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$6.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	of our pro rata share of EBITDA from Blue Mountain while fiscal 2015 included 100% of Blue Mountain&#8217;s revenue and operating expenses, which were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$57.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$44.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, respectively, following the Acquisition Date. Excluding Blue Mountain and unfavorable foreign currency adjustments, Mountain revenue increased&#160;$24.9 million,&#160;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	7.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	, in fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	,&#160;partially offset by a $16.5 million increase in Mountain operating expenses, resulting in an increase to Mountain Adjusted EBITDA of $8.4 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Same Store Comparison of Mountain Results for the Year Ended June 30, 2016
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Given the impact that the foreign currency adjustments, the disposition of IRCG in fiscal 2016 and the acquisition of Blue Mountain in fiscal 2015 had on our results, we believe same store metrics are useful in analyzing the underlying performance of our business. Same store growth is calculated in constant currency, as if we owned 100% of Blue Mountain during all of fiscal 2015 and excluding IRCG in both fiscal 2015 and fiscal 2016 ("Same Store"). We calculate constant U.S. dollar amounts by applying prior period average exchange rates to the current comparable period. The following table presents the percentage change of Mountain results as reported and on a Same Store basis from the prior year period:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>

</TD>

<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 1PX SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(14.0

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	)%
</DIV>
</TD>

	Mountain Adjusted EBITDA

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A ID="S5D170B18B3775CADB93B2098AF63E804" NAME="FORM10K_HTM_S5D170B18B3775CADB93B2098AF63E804">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Adventure
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue and Adventure Adjusted EBITDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Adventure segment earns revenue from a variety of activities conducted at CMH. CMH revenue is derived primarily from the sale of adventure packages that include helicopter accessed skiing, mountaineering or hiking, lodging at facilities owned or leased by CMH and food and beverage services. In addition to package revenue, CMH earns ancillary revenue from the sale of additional vertical meters of skiing, retail merchandise, alcoholic beverages, spa services and the sale of other products and services not included in the vacation package.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Adventure segment also generates ancillary revenue relating to performance of fire suppression services during the summer months in the Western United States and Western Canada. These activities are performed on an as-needed basis or pursuant to contracts that have a term of one to five years. Ancillary revenue is also derived from MRO services performed by Alpine Aerotech LP on third-party aircraft, as well as from leasing aircraft to unaffiliated third parties.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Adventure Adjusted EBITDA.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Adventure Adjusted EBITDA is Adventure revenue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	less
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Adventure operating expenses, adjusted for Adjusted EBITDA attributable to noncontrolling interests. Adventure operating expenses consist primarily of compensation and benefits, fuel, aircraft and facility maintenance and manufacturing expenses, insurance, utilities, permit and lease payments, credit card fees, food and beverage costs, and general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 120%; FONT-FAMILY: INHERIT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

<TABLE STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ID="ZD6F14CCA6BDE44E68EDF9E3C09B0D198" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; PADDING-LEFT: 2PX; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-TOP: 2PX">

	&#160;
