<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	U.S. DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FOREST SERVICE
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	SKI AREA TERM SPECIAL USE PERMIT
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	AUTHORITY: Ski Area Permit Act of 1986
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	City and County of Denver, Winter Park Recreational Association (WPRA), as Agent.&#160; P.O. Box 36, Winter Park, CO 80482.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Winter Park Recreational Association (the holder) is authorized to use and occupy National Forest System (NFS) lands on the Arapaho National Forest, subject to the terms and conditions of this term special use permit (the permit).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	This permit covers 7,555 acres in portions of sections 3-5, 8-10, 14-17, 20-23, 26-29, 32, 33 in T.2S.,R.75 W., 6
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	th
</SUP>
	P.M. (the permit area), as shown on the map attached as Appendix A.&#160; This permit is issued for the purpose of: Operating, maintaining, and constructing, as defined the Master Development plan, a four-season resort.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Improvements authorized in the permit area are listed in Appendix B.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Services authorized in the permit area are listed in Appendix C.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Inventory of Ski Area Water Facilities and Original Water Rights are listed in Appendix D.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Environmental Site Report is listed in Appendix E.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	TERMS AND CONDITIONS
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	I.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	GENERAL TERMS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	AUTHORITY
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	This permit is issued pursuant to the National Forest Ski Area Permit Act of 1986, 16 U.S.C. 497b, and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	36 CFR Part 251, Subpart B, as amended, and is subject to their provisions.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	AUTHORIZED OFFICER
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The authorized officer is the Forest Supervisor or a subordinate officer with delegated authority.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	TERM
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit shall expire at midnight on April 29, 2056, 40 years from the date of issuance.&#160; Expiration of this permit shall not require notice, a decision document, or any environmental analysis or other documentation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CONTINUATION OF USE AND OCCUPANCY
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	Upon expiration of this permit, the use and occupancy authorized by this permit may not continue unless a new permit is issued.&#160; The authorized officer may prescribe new terms and conditions when a new permit is issued.&#160; Prior to expiration of this permit, the holder may apply for a new permit that would renew
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	the use and occupancy
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	authorized by this permit.&#160; Applications for a new permit must be submitted at least one year prior to expiration of this permit.&#160; Continuation of the use and occupancy authorized by this permit shall be at the sole discretion of the authorized officer.&#160; At a minimum, before issuing a new permit, the authorized officer shall ensure that (1) the use and occupancy to be authorized by the new permit is consistent with the standards and guidelines in the applicable land management plan; (2) the type of use and occupancy to be authorized by the new permit is the same type of use and occupancy authorized by this permit; and (3) the holder is in compliance with all of the terms of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	AMENDMENT
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; This permit may be amended in whole or in part by the Forest Service when, at the discretion of the authorized officer, such action is deemed necessary or desirable to incorporate new terms that are required by law, regulation, the applicable land management plan, or projects and activities implementing a land management plan pursuant to 36 CFR Part 218.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; At the sole discretion of the authorized officer, this permit may be amended to remove authorization to use any NFS lands not specifically covered in the master development plan for this permit or not needed for the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; The holder may apply for an amendment to this permit to cover new or changed uses or areas.&#160; In approving or denying an amendment, the authorized officer shall consider, in addition to the requirements in applicable laws and regulations, the findings or recommendations of other affected agencies and whether the new or changed use or area can be accommodated by an amendment to this permit, or whether a new permit should be issued.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS, REGULATIONS, AND OTHER LEGAL REQUIREMENTS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; In exercising the privileges granted by this permit, the holder shall comply with all present and future federal laws and regulations and all present and future state, county, and municipal laws, regulations, and other legal requirements that apply to the permit area, to the extent they do not conflict with federal law, regulation, or policy.&#160; The Forest Service assumes no responsibility for enforcing laws, regulations, and other legal requirements that fall under the jurisdiction of other governmental entities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	NON-EXCLUSIVE USE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The use and occupancy authorized by this permit are not exclusive.&#160; The Forest Service reserves the right of access to the permit area, including a continuing right of physical entry to the permit area for inspection, monitoring, or any other purpose consistent with any right or obligation of the United States under any law or regulation.&#160; The Forest Service reserves the right to allow others to use the permit area in any way that is not inconsistent with the holder&#8217;s rights and privileges under this permit, after consultation with all parties involved.&#160; Except for any restrictions that the holder and the authorized officer agree are necessary to protect the installation and operation of authorized improvements, the permit area shall remain open to the public for all lawful purposes.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	H.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ASSIGNABILITY
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit is not assignable or transferable.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	I.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	TRANSFER OF TITLE TO THE IMPROVEMENTS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Notification of Transfer
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; The holder shall notify the authorized officer when a transfer of title to all or part of the improvements is planned.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Transfer of Title
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Any transfer of title to the improvements covered by this permit shall result in termination of the permit.&#160; The party who acquires title to the improvements must submit an application for a permit.&#160; The Forest Service is not obligated to issue a new permit to the party who acquires title to the improvements.&#160; The authorized officer shall determine that the applicant meets requirements under applicable federal regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	J.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	CHANGE IN CONTROL OF THE BUSINESS ENTITY
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Notification of Change in Control
</U>
</FONT>
	. The holder shall notify the authorized officer when a change in control of the business entity that holds this permit is planned.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a.&#160; In the case of a corporation, control is an interest, beneficial or otherwise, of sufficient outstanding voting securities or capital of the business so as to permit the exercise of managerial authority over the actions and operations of the corporation or election of a majority of the board of directors of the corporation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b.&#160; In the case of a partnership, limited partnership, joint venture, or individual entrepreneurship, control is a beneficial ownership of or interest in the entity or its capital so as to permit the exercise of managerial authority over the actions and operations of the entity.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c.&#160; In other circumstances, control is any arrangement under which a third party has the ability to exercise management authority over the actions or operations of the business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Effect of Change in Control
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Any change in control of the business entity as defined in clause J.1 shall result in termination of this permit.&#160; The party acquiring control must submit an application for a special use permit.&#160; The Forest Service is not obligated to issue a new permit to the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	party who acquires control.&#160; The authorized officer shall determine whether the applicant meets the requirements established by applicable federal regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	II.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	IMPROVEMENTS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	LIMITATIONS ON USE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Nothing in this permit gives or implies permission to build or maintain any structure or facility or to conduct any activity unless specifically authorized by this permit.&#160; Any use not specifically authorized by this permit must be proposed in accordance with 36 CFR 251.54.&#160; Approval of such a proposal through issuance of a new permit or permit amendment is at the sole discretion of the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	2
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage139"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	PLANS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	All plans for development, layout, construction, reconstruction, or alteration of improvements in the permit area, as well as revisions to those plans, must be prepared by a licensed engineer, architect, landscape architect, or other qualified professional acceptable to the authorized officer.&#160; These plans and plan revisions must have written approval from the authorized officer before they are implemented.&#160; The authorized officer may require the holder to furnish as-built plans, maps, or surveys upon completion of the work.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	MASTER DEVELOPMENT PLAN
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall prepare and maintain, in a form acceptable to the Forest Service, a master development plan (MDP) encompassing the entire four-season resort presently envisioned for development in connection with the NFS lands authorized by this permit.&#160; The MDP should encompass all NFS lands authorized for use by this permit.&#160; For planning purposes, a capacity for the ski area measured in people-at-one time shall be established in the MDP.&#160; Upon acceptance by the authorized officer, the MDP shall become a part of this permit.&#160; Overall development at the ski area authorized by the permit shall not exceed the capacity established in the MDP, and additional construction beyond maintenance of existing improvements at the ski area covered by this permit shall not be authorized without amendment of the MDP and without the requisite environmental analysis and documentation needed to support that additional construction or development under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA).&#160; The holder shall propose any changes to the MDP in a form acceptable to the Forest Service and shall submit the proposed changes to the authorized officer.&#160; Once accepted, the revised MDP shall become a part of this permit.&#160; Acceptance of the original or revised MDP by the authorized officer does not authorize new development or uses.&#160; The authorized officer&#8217;s acceptance of the original or revised MDP does not constitute approval of its contents or provide any assurance that any particular item in the original or revised MDP will be authorized by the Forest Service or constructed by the holder.&#160; No rights or obligations of the holder or the Forest Service are determined by the authorized officer&#8217;s acceptance of the original or revised MDP, nor do any legal consequences, including the requirement to conduct environmental analysis under NEPA, flow from the authorized officer&#8217;s acceptance of the original or revised MDP.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SITE DEVELOPMENT SCHEDULE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160; The holder and the Forest Service jointly shall prepare a site development schedule, which shall become part of this permit, before any construction occurs in the permit area.&#160; The site development schedule shall list improvements in the master development plan and any amendments to the plan in order of priority, the starting date for their construction, and the due date for their completion.&#160; All required plans and specifications for improvements included in the site development schedule shall be properly certified and submitted to the authorized officer at least 45 days before the starting date for their construction.&#160; The holder may accelerate the scheduled date for completion of any improvement, as long as the other scheduled improvements are completed on time and to the satisfaction of the authorized officer.&#160; Any other changes to the site development schedule must have prior written approval from the authorized officer.&#160; Pursuant to clause IV.L, the authorized officer may require a performance bond for improvements constructed under a site development schedule.
</FONT>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ROPEWAY PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; All plans for uphill equipment and infrastructure shall be properly certified as being in accordance with the American National Standard Institute (ANSI)&#8217;s Standard Safety Requirements for Aerial Passenger Tramways (ANSI B77.1 or B77.2).&#160; A complete set of drawings, specifications, and records for each lift shall be maintained by the holder and shall be made available to the Forest Service upon request.&#160; These plans, drawings, specifications, and records shall be retained by the holder and kept available for review for 3 years after removal of the uphill equipment and infrastructure from NFS lands.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	III.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	OPERATIONS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	OPERATING PLAN
</U>
</FONT>
	The holder shall prepare and annually revise by November 1
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	st
</SUP>
	a winter operating plan and by May 1
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	st
</SUP>
	a summer operating plan.&#160; The operating plan shall be prepared in consultation with the authorized officer or the authorized officer&#8217;s designated representative and shall cover all operations authorized by this permit. The operating plan shall outline steps the holder's will take to protect public health and safety and the environment and shall include sufficient detail and standards to enable the Forest Service to monitor the holder&#8217;s operations for compliance with the terms and conditions of this permit.&#160; The operating plan shall be submitted by the holder and approved by the authorized officer or the authorized officer&#8217;s designated representative prior to commencement of operations and shall be attached to this permit as an appendix.&#160; The authorized officer may require an annual meeting with the holder to discuss the terms and conditions of the permit or operating plan, annual use reports, or other concerns either party may have.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A ski area operating plan must address:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZC3109F2BF45C452385CF409BB576EE59" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>

	1.
</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Operation of aerial adventure courses or other summer use facility, if applicable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZD8DCD77E826345FB9DFE93EE4A3DE17C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	17.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Performance bond for construction projects and amount of bond, if applicable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZB4B16434701749E4A60ABF26401AFA01" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	18.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Submission of annual use reports.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	PERIOD OF USE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The use and occupancy authorized by this permit shall be in normal operation at least 160 days each year or season.&#160; Failure of the holder to exercise this minimum use may result in revocation of this permit under clause VII.A.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	RESPONSIBILITY FOR DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; As a general rule, the holder itself or through its operator as described in Clause III.D.2, shall conduct the day-to-day activities authorized by this permit.&#160; A limited amount of activities may be conducted by a party other than the holder, but only with prior written approval of the authorized officer.&#160; The holder shall continue to be responsible for compliance with all the terms of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	LEASING
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	In General
</U>
</FONT>
	. Subject to Clause III.C, the holder may lease authorized concessions and improvements owned by the holder that are located within the permit area with the prior written approval of the authorized officer.&#160; The Forest Service reserves the right to disapprove these leases.&#160; The holder shall remain responsible for compliance of the leased concessions and improvements with all the terms and conditions of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Lease for Ski Area Operations.
</U>
</FONT>
	&#160; Pursuant to clause III.D.1, the authorized officer has approved a lease between the holder and Intrawest\Winter Park Operations Corporation (Intrawest) for operation of the authorized improvements (the lease) under the terms of this permit.&#160; Intrawest is executing this permit in the capacity of a lessee under the lease, rather than as a holder. Intrawest is subject to all obligations in sections III, IV, V, and VI and clauses VII.A.1, VII.A.2, VII.C, and VII.G, and is also bound to comply with all terms of the lease in operating the authorized improvements.&#160; In signing this permit, except as otherwise specifically provided herein, Intrawest is not acquiring any rights or privileges under this permit.&#160; This clause and Intrawest&#8217;s execution of this permit shall not (a) create, enlarge, diminish, or otherwise affect any right or obligation of Intrawest or the holder under the lease or any other agreement or (b) in any way affect the rights of the holder to terminate the lease.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CONDITION OF OPERATIONS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall maintain the authorized improvements and permit area to standards of repair, orderliness, neatness, sanitation, and safety acceptable to the authorized officer and consistent with other provisions of this permit.&#160; Standards are subject to periodic change by the authorized officer.&#160; The holder shall comply with inspection requirements deemed appropriate by the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	FOREST SERVICE MONITORING
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Forest Service shall monitor the holder's operations and reserves the right to inspect the permitted facilities and improvements at any time for compliance with the terms of this permit.&#160; The obligations of the holder under this permit are not contingent upon any duty of the Forest Service to inspect the premises.&#160; A failure by the Forest Service or other governmental officials to inspect is not a defense to noncompliance with any of the terms and conditions of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	REMOVAL AND PLANTING OF VEGETATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit does not authorize the cutting of timber or other vegetation.&#160; Trees or shrubbery may be removed or destroyed only after the authorized officer or the authorized officer's designated representative has approved in writing and marked or otherwise identified what may be removed or destroyed.&#160; Timber cut or destroyed shall be paid for at current stumpage rates for similar timber in the Arapaho National Forest.&#160; The Forest Service reserves the right to dispose of the merchantable timber to those other than the holder at no stumpage cost to the holder.&#160; Unmerchantable material shall be disposed of as directed by the authorized officer.&#160; Trees, shrubs, and other plants may be planted within the permit area with prior written
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	approval of the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	H.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SIGNAGE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Signage posted on NFS lands must have prior written approval of the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	I.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	REFUSE DISPOSAL
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall comply with all applicable federal, state, and local requirements related to the disposal of refuse resulting from the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	J.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SANITATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The operation and maintenance of all sanitation, food service, and water-supply methods, systems, and facilities shall comply with applicable standards set by state and local health departments.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	4
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage141"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	K.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	DRINKING WATER SYSTEM
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder, as the water supplier and owner or operator of the drinking water system for the facilities authorized by this permit, is responsible for compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local drinking water laws and regulations governing operation and maintenance of a public drinking water system, including but not limited to developing, operating, and maintaining the system and conducting drinking water testing and taking appropriate corrective and follow-up actions in accordance with federal, state, and any other applicable requirements.&#160; For purposes of this permit, public water systems are defined in accordance with the Safe Drinking Water Act, as amended (42 U.S.C. 300f
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	.), and the National Primary Drinking Water Regulations, 40 CFR Part 141, or state regulations, if more stringent.&#160; The holder shall retain all drinking water system records as required by applicable laws and regulations.&#160; The holder agrees to make the records available to the Forest Service and to any other regulatory agency authorized to review Forest Service activities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	L.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ROPEWAY INSPECTIONS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The holder at its expense shall have all passenger ropeways inspected by a qualified engineer or ropeway specialist before commencement of operations each year.&#160; The holder shall have the inspection documented in a report that is certified by the qualified engineer or ropeway specialist and that contains the following statement:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	This is a report of the audiovisual field survey of WPRA&#8217;s passenger ropeways on National Forest System lands per ANSI B77.1 or B77.2.&#160; The survey has been performed in accordance with the general inspection provisions of ANSI B77.1 or B77.2 as interpreted by Accredited Standards Committee (ASC) B77.&#160; This survey is not intended to provide engineering information, advice, or consultation to WPRA beyond that required by the general inspection provisions of ANSI B77.1 or B77.2 as interpreted by ASC B77.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Inspections shall be made in accordance with the current edition of ANSI B77.1 or B77.2.&#160; The most current edition of ANSI B77.1 or B77.2 becomes effective 1 year from the ANSI Board of Standards Review approval date.&#160; A certificate of inspection, signed by an officer of the holder's company, attesting to the adequacy and safety of the installations and equipment authorized by this permit for public use shall be received by the Forest Service prior to commencement of operations each year.&#160; At a minimum, the certificate of inspection shall state:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Pursuant to WPRA&#8217;s permit for passenger ropeways, WPRA has had an inspection of the passenger ropeways performed to determine their compliance with ANSI B77.1 or B77.2.&#160; WPRA has received the results of that inspection and has made and documented corrections of all deficiencies noted in the inspection report.&#160; The passenger ropeways authorized by WPRA&#8217;s permit are ready for public use.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	M.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	HOLDER&#8217;S REPRESENTATIVE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder or the holder&#8217;s designated representative shall be within the permit area at all times when the facilities are open to the public.&#160; The holder shall notify the authorized officer in writing who the holder&#8217;s representative will be.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	N.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	NONDISCRIMINATION
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; The holder and its employees shall not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, sex (in educational and training programs), national origin, age, or disability or by curtailing or refusing to furnish accommodations, facilities, services, or use privileges offered to the public generally.&#160; In addition, the holder and its employees shall comply with the provisions of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 as amended, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, as amended, and the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; The holder shall include and require compliance with the above nondiscrimination provisions in any third-party agreement made with respect to the operations authorized under this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; The Forest Service shall furnish signs setting forth this policy of nondiscrimination.&#160; These signs shall be conspicuously displayed at the public entrance to the premises and at other exterior or interior locations, as directed by the Forest Service.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160; The Forest Service shall have the right to enforce the foregoing nondiscrimination provisions by suit for specific performance or by any other available remedy under the laws of the United States or the state in which the violation occurs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	O.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	EQUAL ACCESS TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; In addition to the above nondiscrimination policy, the holder agrees to insure that its programs and activities are open to the general public on an equal basis and without regard to any non-merit factor.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	P.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	PROHIBITION OF TIME-SHARE ARRANGEMENTS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	No commercial lodging facilities on NFS lands authorized under this permit shall be operated under a time-share or interval-ownership arrangement.&#160; All authorized commercial lodging facilities on NFS lands, except for employee housing authorized pursuant to Forest Service Manual 2341.5, shall be made available to the general public on a short-term rental basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	5
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Q.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	LIQUOR SALES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	The sale of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	liquor or beer and wine
</U>
</FONT>
	is allowed in the permit area contingent upon a valid State license.&#160; However, if in the judgment of the authorized officer undesirable conditions develop as a result of this privilege, the sale of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	liquor or beer and wine
</U>
</FONT>
	shall cease.&#160; The holder shall be informed in writing by the authorized officer if the sale of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	liquor or beer and wine
</U>
</FONT>
	must cease.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	R.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	GAMBLING
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Gambling and gambling machines and devices are prohibited on NFS lands, regardless of whether they are lawful under state or local law.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IV.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	RIGHTS AND LIABILITIES
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	LEGAL EFFECT OF THE PERMIT
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit, which is revocable and terminable, is not a contract or a lease, but rather a federal license.&#160; The benefits and requirements conferred by this permit are reviewable solely under the procedures set forth in 36 CFR Part 214, and 5 U.S.C. 704.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	This permit does not constitute a contract for purposes of the Contract Disputes Act, 41 U.S.C. 601.&#160; The permit is not real property, does not convey any interest in real property, and may not be used as collateral for a loan.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	VALID OUTSTANDING RIGHTS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit is subject to all valid outstanding rights.&#160; Valid outstanding rights include those derived under mining and mineral leasing laws of the United States.&#160; The United States is not liable to the holder for the exercise of any such right.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ABSENCE OF THIRD-PARTY BENEFICIARY RIGHTS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The parties to this permit do not intend to confer any rights on any third party as a beneficiary under this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	NO WARRANTY OF ACCESS, SITE SUITABLITY, OR SERVICES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	This permit authorizes the use and occupancy of National Forest System lands by the holder for the purposes identified in this permit.&#160; The Forest Service does not make any express or implied warranty of access to the permit area, of the suitability of the site for the permitted uses, or for the furnishing of road maintenance, water, fire protection, or any other such service by a government agency, utility, association, or individual.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	RISK OF LOSS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The holder assumes all risk of loss to the authorized improvements and all risk of loss of use and occupancy of the permit area, in whole or in part, due to public health and safety or environmental hazards.&#160; Loss to the authorized improvements and of use and occupancy of the permit area may result from but is not limited to theft, vandalism, fire and any fire-fighting activities (including prescribed burns), environmental contamination, avalanches, rising waters, winds, falling limbs or trees, and other forces of nature.&#160; If authorized improvements in the permit area are destroyed or substantially damaged, the authorized officer shall conduct an analysis to determine whether the improvements can be safely occupied in the future and whether rebuilding should be allowed.&#160; If rebuilding is not allowed, the permit shall terminate. If the authorized officer determines that the permit area cannot be safely occupied due to a public health or safety or environmental hazard, the permit shall terminate. Termination under this clause does not constitute revocation for specific and compelling reasons in the public interest under clause VII.B and shall not give rise to any claim for damages, including lost profits and the value of the improvements, by the holder against the Forest Service.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	WATER FACILITIES AND WATER RIGHTS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8220;Used primarily for operation of the ski area&#8221; in relation to a water facility or water right means that the water facility or water right provides significantly more water for operation of the permitted portion of the ski area than any other use.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8220;Sufficient quantity of water to operate the ski area&#8221; means that under typical conditions, taking into account fluctuations in utilization of the authorized improvements, fluctuations in weather and climate, changes in technology, and other factors deemed appropriate by the holder&#8217;s qualified hydrologist or licensed engineer, the holder has sufficient water rights or access to a sufficient quantity of water to operate the permitted facilities, and to provide for the associated activities authorized under the ski area permit in accordance with the approved operating plan.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1. Water Facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a. The term &#8220;water facility&#8221; means a facility located on NFS lands that diverts withdraws, stores, or distributes water, such as a diversion, ditch, pipeline, reservoir, well, tank, impoundment structure, or similar facility or feature.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b. The term &#8220;ski area water facility&#8221; means any water facility on NFS lands that is authorized by this permit and used primarily for operation of the ski area authorized by this permit (hereinafter &#8220;ski area&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c. The authorized officer may place conditions, as necessary to protect public property, public safety, cultural resources, and natural resources on NFS lands, on the installation, operation, maintenance, and removal of any water facility, but only in accordance with applicable law. This clause D-30 does not expand or contract the agency&#8217;s authority to place conditions on the installation, operation, maintenance, and removal of water facilities at issuance or reissuance of the permit, throughout the permit term, or otherwise. The holder must comply with present and future laws, regulations, and other legal requirements in accordance with section I of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	6
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	d. Only ski area water facilities may be authorized by this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	e. If due to a change (e.g., due to a change in the ownership of the water facility or the associated water rights or a change in the beneficial use, location, or season of use of the water) a ski area water facility will primarily be used for purposes other than operation of the ski area, the authorization for that ski area water facility under this permit shall terminate. Unless the holder has a valid existing right for the water facility to be situated on NFS lands, the holder must obtain a separate special use authorization to operate that water facility or to develop any new water facility on NFS lands that is used primarily for purposes other than operation of the ski area. When such facilities continue to support approved ski area operations at any time of year, the separate special use authorization for these water facilities shall not contain any possessory interest policy based on FSM 2541.32, paragraph 2 (or similar clauses), any waiver provision, or any power of attorney provision. Unless the holder has a valid existing right for the water facility to be situated on NFS lands, if the holder does not obtain a separate special use authorization for these water facilities, the holder shall remove them from NFS lands.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2. Water Rights. The term &#8220;water right&#8221; as used below means a right to use water that is recognized under state law under the prior appropriation doctrine. This permit does not confer any water rights.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3. Acquisition and Maintenance of Water Rights.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a. Terms.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(1) The term &#8220;ski area water right&#8221; means any water right for use of water from a point of diversion on NFS lands, either inside or outside the permit boundary, that is primarily for operation of the ski area.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(2) The term &#8220;original water right&#8221; means any existing or new ski area water right with a point of diversion that was or is, at all times during its use, located within the permit boundary for this ski area and originally established under state law through an application for a decree to state water court, permitting, beneficial use, or otherwise recognized method of establishing a new water right, in each case by the holder or a prior holder of the ski area permit. The term &#8220;original water right&#8221; shall not include any &#8220;acquired water right&#8221; and shall not be deemed to become an &#8220;acquired water right&#8221; by virtue of the sale of the original water right to a subsequent holder of the ski area permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(3) The term &#8220;acquired water right&#8221; means any ski area water right that is purchased, bartered, exchanged, leased, or contracted by the holder or by any prior holder, except as expressly provided in the last sentence of paragraph F.3.a(2).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b. An inventory of all ski area water facilities and original water rights is included in Appendix D of this permit and shall be updated by the holder upon reissuance of this permit, upon installation or removal of a ski area water facility, when a listed ski area
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	water facility is no longer authorized by this permit, or when an original water right is no longer used for operation of the ski area.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c. Original water rights must be established in accordance with applicable state law. The holder, not the United States, shall bear the cost of establishing, acquiring, maintaining, and perfecting original water rights, including any original water rights owned solely or jointly by the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	d. Original water rights owned solely by the United States and the United States&#8217; interest in jointly owned original water rights shall remain in federal ownership. Notwithstanding the holder&#8217;s obligation to maintain original water rights owned by the United States, the United States reserves the right to take any action necessary to maintain and protect those water rights, including submitting any applications or other filings that may be necessary to protect the water rights.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4. Ensuring Sufficiency of Water Rights and Water for Permitted Ski Area Operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a. Where the United States solely or jointly owns water rights used by the holder, the Forest Service shall not divide or transfer ownership of or seek any change in those water rights that would adversely affect their availability for operation of the ski area during the term of this permit, unless required to comply with a statute or an involuntary court order that is binding on the Forest Service.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b. Where the holder solely or jointly owns original water rights, the holder shall not divide or transfer ownership of or seek any change in those water rights that would adversely affect their availability for operation of the ski area during the term of this permit, unless approved in writing in advance by the authorized officer. In deciding whether to grant this approval, the authorized officer shall consider any documentation prepared by the holder&#8217;s qualified hydrologist or licensed engineer demonstrating that such action will not result in a lack of a sufficient quantity of water to operate the permitted portion of the ski area.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	7
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c. At any time and solely within its discretion, the holder may seek to change, abandon, lease, divide, or transfer ownership of or take other actions with respect to acquired water rights. Following such actions, paragraph F.1.e shall apply to the associated ski area water facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	5. Transfer of Certain Water Rights With Sale of the Ski Area Improvements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a. Upon termination or revocation of this permit, the holder shall offer to sell the holder&#8217;s interest in any solely or jointly owned original water rights at market value to the succeeding permit holder. If the succeeding permit holder declines to purchase original water rights owned solely by the holder, the holder may transfer them to a third party. If the succeeding permit holder declines to purchase the holder&#8217;s interest in original water rights jointly held with the United States, the holder shall offer to sell that interest at market value to the United States. If the United States declines to purchase that interest, the holder may abandon, divide, lease, or transfer its interest at its sole discretion. This clause imposes no restrictions on acquired water rights. There are no restrictions on the transfer or abandonment of acquired water rights. In all instances, the holder shall retain the full amount of any consideration paid for water rights. Following such actions, paragraph F.1.e shall apply to the associated ski area water facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b. If the Forest Service does not reauthorize the ski area, the holder may submit a proposal to the Forest Service for a permit authorizing a different use for the ski area water facilities. If a different use is not authorized for those water facilities, the holder shall remove them from NFS lands. The holder may, in its sole discretion, abandon, divide, lease, or transfer any water rights solely owned by the holder. The holder shall offer to sell to the United States the holder&#8217;s interest in original water rights jointly owned with the United States at market value. If the United States declines to purchase that interest, the holder may abandon, divide, lease, or transfer its interest at its sole discretion.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	DAMAGE TO UNITED STATES PROPERTY
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder has an affirmative duty to protect from damage the land, property, and other interests of the United States that are associated with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.&#160; Damage includes but is not limited to destruction of or damage to NFS lands covered by this permit, fire suppression costs, and destruction of or damage to government-owned improvements covered by this permit
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	1.&#160;&#160; The holder shall be liable for all injury, loss, or damage, including fire suppression, or other costs in connection with rehabilitation or restoration of natural resources associated with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.&#160; Compensation shall include but not be limited to the value of resources damaged or destroyed, the costs of restoration, cleanup, or other mitigation, fire suppression or other types of abatement costs, and all administrative, legal (including attorney's fees), and other costs in connection therewith.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	2.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall be liable for damage to all roads and trails of the United States open to public use caused by use of the holder or the holder's heirs, assigns, agents, employees, contractors, or lessees to the same extent as provided under clause IV.G.1, except that liability shall not include reasonable and ordinary wear and tear.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	H.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	HEALTH AND SAFETY
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall address the health and safety of its employees, agents, and clients by having trained and qualified staff and, utilizing properly maintained equipment.&#160; The holder, in accordance with applicable federal and state law shall avoid situations or conditions that cause or threaten to cause a hazard to public health or the safety of the holder&#8217;s employees, agents, or clients. This clause does not alter in any way the statutory protections afforded to ski areas with respect to inherent risks or common law protections afforded to ski areas through the assumption of risk doctrine
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
</FONT>
	The holder shall as soon as practicable notify the authorized officer of all serious incidents that occur in connection with such activities.&#160; The Forest Service has no duty under the terms of this permit to inspect the permit area or operations and activities of the holder for hazardous conditions or compliance with health and safety standards.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	I.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160;&#160; For purposes of clauses IV.I and V, "hazardous material" shall mean (a) any hazardous substance under section 101(14) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA), 42 U.S.C. 9601(14); (b) any pollutant or contaminant under section 101(33) of CERCLA, 42 U.S.C. 9601(33); (c) any petroleum product or its derivative, including fuel oil, and waste oils; and (d) any hazardous substance, extremely hazardous substance, toxic substance, hazardous waste, ignitable, reactive or corrosive materials, pollutant, contaminant, element, compound, mixture, solution or substance that may pose a present or potential hazard to human health or the environment under any applicable environmental laws.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;&#160; The holder shall avoid damaging or contaminating the environment, including but not limited to the soil, vegetation (such as trees, shrubs, and grass), surface water, and groundwater, during the holder's use and occupancy of the permit area.&#160; Environmental damage includes but is not limited to all costs and damages associated with or resulting from the release or threatened release of a hazardous material occurring during or as a result of activities of the holder or the holder's heirs, assigns, agents, employees, contractors, or lessees on, or related to, the lands, property, and other interests covered by this permit.&#160; If the environment or any government property covered by this permit becomes damaged in connection with the holder's use and occupancy, the holder shall as soon as practicable repair the damage or replace the damaged items to the satisfaction of the authorized officer and at no expense to the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	8
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160;&#160; The holder shall as soon as practicable, as completely as possible, and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations abate any activity or condition arising out of or relating to the authorized use and occupancy that causes or threatens to cause harm to the environment, including areas of vegetation or timber, fish or other wildlife populations, their habitats, or any other natural resources.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	J.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	INDEMNIFICATION OF THE UNITED STATES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the United States for any costs, damages, claims, liabilities, and judgments arising from past, present, and future acts or omissions of the holder in connection with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.&#160; This indemnification provision includes but is not limited to acts and omissions of the holder or the holder's heirs, assigns, agents, employees, contractors, or lessees in connection with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit which result in (1) violations of any laws and regulations which are now or which may in the future become applicable, including but not limited to the environmental laws listed in clause V.A of this permit; (2) judgments, claims, demands, penalties, or fees assessed against the United States; (3) costs, expenses, and damages incurred by the United States; or (4) the release or threatened release of any solid waste, hazardous waste, hazardous materials, pollutant, contaminant, oil in any form, or petroleum product into the environment.&#160; The authorized officer may prescribe terms that allow the holder to replace, repair, restore, or otherwise undertake necessary curative activities to mitigate damages in addition or as an alternative to monetary indemnification.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	K.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	INSURANCE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall furnish proof of insurance, such as a certificate of insurance, to the authorized officer prior to issuance of this permit and each year thereafter that this permit is in effect.&#160; The Forest Service reserves the right to review the insurance policy and require any changes needed to ensure adequate coverage of the United States in connection with the authorized use and occupancy.&#160; The holder shall send an authenticated copy of any insurance policy obtained pursuant to this clause to the authorized officer immediately upon issuance of the policy.&#160; Any insurance policies obtained by the holder pursuant to this clause shall name the United States as an additional insured, and the additional insured provision shall provide for insurance coverage for the United States as required under this clause.&#160; The holder shall give 30 days prior written notice to the authorized officer of cancellation of the insurance policy by the holder or any modification to the insurance policy by the holder.&#160; Additionally, the holder shall immediately notify the authorized officer of cancellation of the policy by the insurance company. The certificate
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	of insurance, the authenticated copy of the insurance policy, and written notice of cancellation or modification of insurance policies should be sent to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	9 Ten Mile Drive, PO Box 10 Granby, CO 80446.
</FONT>
	&#160; Minimum amounts of coverage and other insurance requirements are subject to change at the sole discretion of the authorized officer on the anniversary date of this permit
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; The holder shall have in force liability insurance covering losses associated with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit arising from personal injury or death and third-party property damage in the minimum amount of:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	$
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	500,000.00
</FONT>
</FONT>
	for injury or death to one person per occurrence;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	$
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2,000,000.00
</FONT>
	for injury or death to more than one person per occurrence; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	$
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	25,000.00
</FONT>
	for third-party property damage per occurrence.
</DIV>
