<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Depending on the holder's operations, the Forest Service may require the holder to demonstrate the availability of funds to address any release or threatened release of hazardous materials that may occur in connection with the holder's use and occupancy.&#160; Any requirements imposed would be established case by case by the authorized officer based on the degree of environmental risk from the holder's operations.&#160; The storage and use of normal
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	maintenance supplies in nominal amounts generally would not trigger financial assurance requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	L.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	BONDING
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The authorized officer may require the holder to furnish a surety bond or other security for any of the obligations imposed by the terms and conditions of this permit or any applicable law, regulation, or order.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	V.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	RESOURCE PROTECTION
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	COMPLIANCE WITH ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall in connection with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit comply with all applicable federal, state, and local environmental laws and regulations, including but not limited to those established pursuant to the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, as amended, 42 U.S.C. 6901
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the Federal Water Pollution Control Act, as amended, 33 U.S.C. 1251
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the Oil Pollution Act, as amended, 33 U.S.C. 2701
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the Clean Air Act, as amended, 42 U.S.C. 7401
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the CERCLA, as amended, 42 U.S.C. 9601
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the Toxic Substances Control Act, as amended, 15 U.S.C. 2601
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act, as amended, 7 U.S.C. 136
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., and the Safe Drinking Water Act, as amended, 42 U.S.C. 300f
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	WATER POLLUTION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; No waste or by-product shall be discharged into water if it contains any substance in concentrations which will result in harm to fish and wildlife, or to human water supplies.&#160; Storage facilities for materials capable of causing water pollution, if accidentally discharged, shall be located so as to prevent any spillage into waters or channels leading into water that would result in harm to fish and wildlife or to human water supplies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	9
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage146"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ESTHETICS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall protect the scenic esthetic values of the permit area and the adjacent land to the greatest extent possible during construction, operation, and maintenance of the authorized improvements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	VANDALISM
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall take reasonable measures to prevent and discourage vandalism or disorderly conduct and when necessary shall contact the appropriate law enforcement officer to address these problems.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	HERBICIDE AND
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	&#160;
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	PESTICIDE USE
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Herbicides and pesticides may not be used outside of buildings to control undesirable woody and herbaceous vegetation, aquatic plants, insects, rodents, or fish without the prior written approval of the authorized officer.&#160; A request for approval of planned uses of pesticides shall be submitted annually by the holder on the due date established by the authorized officer.&#160; The report shall cover a 12-month period of planned use beginning 3 months after the reporting date.&#160; Information essential for review shall be provided in the form specified.&#160; Exceptions to this schedule may be allowed, subject to emergency request and approval, only when unexpected outbreaks of pests require control measures which were not anticipated at the time an annual report was submitted.&#160; Only those materials registered by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for the specific purpose planned shall be authorized for use on NFS lands.&#160; Label instructions and all applicable laws and regulations shall be strictly followed in the application of pesticides and disposal of excess materials and containers.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND PALEONTOLOGICAL DISCOVERIES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall immediately notify the authorized officer of all antiquities or other objects of historic or scientific interest, including but not limited to historic or prehistoric ruins, fossils, or artifacts discovered in connection with the use and occupancy authorized by this permit.&#160; The holder shall leave these discoveries intact and in place until directed otherwise by the authorized officer.&#160; Protective and mitigative measures specified by the authorized officer shall be the responsibility of the holder.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	NATIVE AMERICAN GRAVES PROTECTION AND REPATRIATION (NAGPRA)
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; In accordance with 25 U.S.C. 3002(d) and 43 CFR 10.4, if the holder inadvertently discovers human remains, funerary objects, sacred objects, or objects of cultural patrimony on NFS lands, the holder shall immediately cease work in the area of the discovery and shall make a reasonable effort to protect and secure the items.&#160; The holder shall immediately notify the authorized officer by telephone of the discovery and shall follow up with written confirmation of the discovery.&#160; The activity that resulted in the inadvertent discovery may not resume until 30 days after the authorized officer certifies receipt of the written confirmation, if resumption of the activity is otherwise lawful, or at any time if a binding written agreement has been executed between the Forest Service and the affiliated Indian tribes that adopts a recovery plan for the human remains and objects.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	H.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	PROTECTION OF HABITAT OF THREATENED, ENDANGERED, AND SENSITIVE SPECIES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The location of sites within the permit area needing special measures for protection of plants or animals listed as threatened or endangered under the Endangered Species Act (ESA) of 1973, 16 U.S.C. 531
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., as amended, or as sensitive by the Regional Forester under Forest Service Manual (FSM) 2670, pursuant to consultation conducted under section 7 of the ESA, may be identified on the ground or shown on a separate map.&#160; The map shall be attached to this permit as an appendix.&#160; The holder shall take any protective and mitigative measures specified by the authorized officer.&#160; If protective and mitigative measures prove inadequate, if other sites within the permit area&#160; containing threatened, endangered, or sensitive species are discovered, or if new species are listed as threatened or endangered under the ESA or as sensitive by the Regional Forester under the FSM, the authorized officer may specify additional protective and mitigative measures.&#160; Discovery of these areas by the holder or the Forest Service shall be promptly reported to the other party.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	I.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CONSENT TO STORE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall not store any hazardous materials at the site without prior written approval from the authorized officer.&#160; This approval shall not be unreasonably withheld.&#160; If the authorized officer provides approval, this permit shall include (or in the case of approval provided after this permit is issued, shall be amended to include) specific terms addressing the storage of hazardous materials, including the specific type of materials to be stored, the volume, the type of storage, and a spill plan.&#160; Such terms shall be proposed by the holder and are subject to approval by the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; If the holder receives consent to store hazardous material, the holder shall identify to the Forest Service any hazardous material to be stored at the site. Such identification information shall be consistent with column (1) of the table of hazardous materials and special provisions enumerated at 49 CFR 172.101 whenever the hazardous material appears in that table.&#160; For hazard communication purposes, the holder shall maintain Material Safety Data Sheets for any stored hazardous chemicals, consistent with 29 CFR 1910.1200(c) and (g).&#160; In addition, all hazardous materials stored by the holder shall be used, labeled, stored, transported, and disposed of in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; If hazardous materials are used or stored at the site, the authorized officer may require the holder to deliver and maintain a surety bond in accordance with clause IV.L.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; The holder shall not release any hazardous material as defined in clause IV.I onto land or into rivers, streams, impoundments, or natural or man-made channels leading to them.&#160; All prudent and safe attempts must be made to contain any release of these materials. The authorized officer may specify conditions that must be met, including conditions more stringent than those imposed by federal, state, and local regulations, to prevent releases and protect natural resources.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	10
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	J.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	CLEANUP AND REMEDIATION
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; The holder shall immediately notify all appropriate response authorities, including the National Response Center and the Forest Service authorized officer or the authorized officer&#8217;s designated representative, of any oil discharge or of the release of a hazardous material in the permit area in an amount greater than or equal to its reportable quantity, in accordance with 33 CFR Part 153, Subpart B, and 40 CFR Part 302.&#160; For the purposes of this requirement, &#8220;oil&#8221; is defined by section 311(a)(1) of the Clean Water Act, 33 U.S.C. 1321(a)(1). The holder shall immediately notify the authorized officer or the authorized officer&#8217;s designated representative of any release or threatened release of any hazardous material in or near the permit area which may be harmful to public health or welfare or which may adversely affect natural resources on federal lands.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; Except with respect to any federally permitted release as that term is defined under section 101(10) of CERCLA, 42 U.S.C. 9601(10), the holder shall clean up or otherwise remediate any release, threat of release, or discharge of hazardous materials that occurs either in the permit area or in connection with the holder's activities in the permit area, regardless of whether those activities are authorized under this permit.&#160; The holder shall perform cleanup or remediation immediately upon discovery of the release, threat of release, or discharge of hazardous materials.&#160; The holder shall perform the cleanup or remediation to the satisfaction of the authorized officer and at no expense to the United States.&#160; Upon revocation or termination of this permit, the holder shall deliver the permit area to the Forest Service free and clear of contamination.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	K.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CERTIFICATION UPON REVOCATION OR TERMINATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	If the holder uses or stores hazardous materials at the site, upon revocation or termination of this permit the holder shall provide the Forest Service with a report certified by a professional or professionals acceptable to the Forest Service that the permit area is uncontaminated by the presence of hazardous materials and that there has not been a release or discharge of hazardous materials upon the permit area, into surface water at or near the permit area, or into groundwater below the permit area during the term of the permit.&#160; If a release or discharge has occurred, the professional or professionals shall document and certify that the release or discharge has been fully remediated and that the permit area is in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	L.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ENVIRONMENTAL SITE REPORT
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; An environmental site report prepared by the holder documenting the known history of the permit area with regard to the storage, release, or disposal of hazardous materials will be attached to and made a part of this permit as Appendix E upon acceptance by the authorized officer.&#160; Upon revocation or termination of this permit, the holder shall prepare another environmental site report, which shall document the environmental condition of the permit area at that time and describe any storage, release, or disposal of hazardous materials during the holder&#8217;s use and occupancy of the permit area.&#160; Both environmental site reports prepared by the holder shall be subject to written approval by the authorized officer.&#160; A comparison of the two reports shall assist the authorized officer in determining whether any environmental cleanup or restoration is required.&#160; Any cleanup or restoration shall be completed promptly by the holder in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	M.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	WATER WELLS AND ASSOCIATED PIPELINES
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Other Jurisdictional Requirements
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Clause IV.D governs water rights and water facilities.&#160; The holder shall obtain all required state and local water permits, licenses, registrations, certificates, or rights and shall provide a copy of them to the authorized officer.&#160; For new wells, this information shall be provided prior to disturbing NFS lands for the purpose of water use or development.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Well Construction or Development
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; For new or reconstruction of existing wells, the holder shall prepare a well construction and development plan and submit it to the authorized officer for approval.&#160; The well development and construction plan must have prior written approval from the authorized officer before well construction or development is initiated.&#160; The holder shall follow applicable federal, state, and local standards for design, construction, and development of new wells or reconstruction of existing wells.&#160; If such standards do not exist, the holder shall follow applicable standards issued by the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM), American Water Works Association (AWWA), or National Ground Water Association (NGWA).&#160; The construction and development plan must identify all potential sources for any proposed water injection during well construction or development.&#160; Only non-chlorinated, potable water may be injected during construction or development of wells to be used for monitoring or water withdrawal.&#160; Copies of all documentation for drilling, constructing, or developing wells, including all drilling, boring, and well construction logs, shall be provided to the authorized officer within 60 days of completion of work.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Water Conservation Plan
</U>
</FONT>
	.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall prepare and submit for written approval by the authorized officer a water conservation plan utilizing appropriate strategies to limit the amount of water removed from NFS lands.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Well Decommissioning
</U>
</FONT>
	.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder shall properly decommission and abandon all wells that are no longer needed or maintained in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local standards for water well abandonment.&#160; If such standards do not exist, the holder shall follow applicable standards issued by the ASTM, AWWA, or NGWA.&#160; At least 30 days prior to initiation of well decommissioning, the holder shall submit a well decommissioning plan to the authorized officer.&#160; The well decommissioning plan shall have written approval from the authorized officer before well decommissioning is initiated.&#160; All documentation of well decommissioning shall be provided to the authorized officer within 60 days of completion of the work.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	11
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	VI.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	LAND USE FEES
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	NEW LAND USE FEE SYSTEM
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The Forest Service shall adjust and calculate land use fees authorized by this permit to reflect any revisions to land use fee provisions in 16 U.S.C. 497c or to comply with any new land use fee system based on market value that may be adopted by statute or otherwise after issuance of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SKI AREA PERMIT FEE CALCULATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The annual ski area permit fee (SAPF) due the United States for the activities authorized by this permit shall be calculated using the following formula:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

	=

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 75%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	(.015 x AGR in bracket 1) + (.025 x AGR in bracket 2) +

</TD>

	(.0275 x AGR in bracket 3) + (.04 x AGR in bracket 4), where:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 10%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>

	the ski area permit fee for use of NFS lands;

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	SAPF Formula
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; The SAPF shall be calculated by summing the products of the amount of the holder's AGR that falls into each of the four revenue brackets multiplied by the applicable percentage rate, as shown in the table below.&#160; AGR shall be determined in accordance with clause VI.B.2.&#160; The SAPF shall be calculated based on the holder's fiscal year, unless mutually agreed otherwise by the holder and the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The four revenue brackets shall be adjusted annually using the consumer price index (CPI-U) issued in FSH 2709.11, chapter 30.&#160; The revenue brackets shall be indexed for the previous calendar year.&#160; The holder's AGR for any fiscal year shall not be split into more than one set of indexed brackets.&#160; Only the revenue in each bracket shall be updated annually.&#160; The percentage rates shall not change.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The revenue brackets and percentages in FSH 2709.11, 38.12, exhibit 01, shall be used as shown in the preceding formula to calculate the SAPF.&#160; The revenue brackets for FY 2016 are shown below.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 80%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z34D6B26061E04E73A4A3B61B86F6F180" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Revenue Brackets* and Corresponding Percentage Rates
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>

	below

	$4,692,000
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 19%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$4,692,000
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&lt;$23,470,000
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 15%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$23,470,000
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$78,233,000
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 17%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	over
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	$78,233,000
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	12
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>
</DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 80%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z4538E36F839344CEA82CBAA40B82AD69" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 80%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	*The Washington Office Director of Recreation, Heritage, and Volunteer Resources updates the revenue brackets annually based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI-U), Table A, which is published monthly at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<U>
	http://www.bls.gov
</U>
</FONT>
	. The rate should be applied prospectively on any payment due on or after January 1 through the next calendar year.&#160; For example, use of the 2012 rate issued in October 2011 should commence for the next set of fee calculations and billings with a due date on or after January 1, 2012.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Calculation of AGR
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; AGR shall be calculated by summing the year-round revenue from the sale of lift tickets and ski school operations prorated for use of NFS lands and from GRAF, prorated as applicable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a. The following shall be included in AGR:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(1)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Prorated LT
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Year-round revenue from sales of alpine and Nordic ski area passes and lift tickets, including revenue generated on private land (such as from lift tickets sold on private land), prorated according to the percentage of use between NFS lands and private land in the ski area per clause VI.B.3.a and VI.B.3.b;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(2)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Prorated SS
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Revenue from alpine and Nordic ski school operations, including lessons provided to teach alpine or Nordic skiing or other winter sports activities, such as racing, snowboarding, or snowshoeing, even if the lessons are purchased on private land, prorated according to the percentage of use between NFS lands and private land in the ski area per clause VI.B.3.a and VI.B.3.b;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(3)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	GRAF, Prorated As Applicable
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Gross year-round revenue from temporary and permanent ancillary facilities, including all the holder's or subholder's lodging, food service, rental shops, parking, and other ancillary operations, located on NFS lands in the permit area, prorated, as applicable, according to the percentage of use between NFS lands and private land in the ski area per clause VI.B.3.c.&#160; Revenue generated from ancillary facilities on private land shall not be included in AGR;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(4)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Bartered Goods and Complimentary Lift Tickets
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; The market price of bartered goods and complimentary lift tickets offered for commercial or other promotional purposes, such as for advertising.&#160; The value of bartered goods and complimentary lift tickets offered for commercial or other promotional purposes shall be categorized as LT, SS, or GRAF, as appropriate; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(5)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Special Event Revenue
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Revenue from events such as food festivals, foot races, and concerts on NFS lands in the permit area.&#160; Special event revenue shall be included in the AGR formula as LT, SS, or GRAF, as applicable.&#160; The revenue shall be prorated according to the percentage of use between NFS lands and private land per clause VI.B.3.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Discriminatory pricing, e.g., pricing based solely on race, religion, sex, national origin, or place of residence, is prohibited under clause III.N or III.O, but if it occurs, the amount that would have been received had discriminatory pricing not occurred shall be included in AGR.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b.&#160; The following shall be excluded from AGR:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(1) Revenue from sales of operating equipment;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(2) Refunds;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(3) Rent paid to the holder by subholders or lessees;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(4) Sponsor contributions to special events;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(5) Employee gratuities and employee lift tickets;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(6) Lift tickets and passes provided for public safety or public service purposes (such as for the National Ski Patrol or for volunteers to assist in the Special Olympics);
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(7) Discounts; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(8) Any other goods and services (other than bartered goods and complimentary lift tickets offered for commercial or other promotional purposes) for which the holder receives no money.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Proration of Revenue
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Alpine and Nordic revenue shall be prorated separately.&#160; Prorated revenues shall be added together and summed with GRAF to produce AGR.&#160; One or more of the following methods, as appropriate, shall be used to prorate revenue:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	13
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a.&#160; Alpine revenue shall be prorated using the slope transport feet percentage (STFP), per the direction in FSM 2715.11c, effective in 1992.&#160; Only uphill devices (lifts, tows, and tramways) that are fundamental to the winter sports operation (usually those located on both federal and private land) shall be included in the calculation.&#160; People movers whose primary purpose is to shuttle people between parking areas or between parking areas and lodges and offices shall not be included.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b.&#160; Nordic revenue shall be prorated using the percentage of Nordic trail length on NFS lands to total Nordic trail length.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c.&#160; For ancillary facilities that are partially located on NFS lands, the ratio of the facility square footage located on NFS lands to the total facility square footage shall be calculated, and the revenue for ancillary facilities shall be prorated in accordance with this ratio.&#160; Special event revenue allocatable to GRAF shall be prorated by the ratio of use on NFS lands to the total use.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Absence of AGR
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; In cases when the holder has no AGR for a given fiscal year, the holder shall pay a land use fee of $2 per acre for NFS lands under permit or a percentage of the appraised value of NFS lands under permit, at the discretion of the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SAPF PAYMENTS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Reports and deposits shall be sent or delivered to the collection officer, USDA, Forest Service, at the address furnished by the authorized officer.&#160; Checks or money orders shall be made payable to USDA, Forest Service.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; The holder shall calculate and submit an advance payment which is due by the beginning of the holder's payment cycle.&#160; The advance payment shall equal 20 percent of the holder's average SAPF for 3 operating years, when available.&#160; When past SAPF information is not available, the advance payment shall equal 20 percent of the SAPF, based on the prior holder's average SAPF or projected AGR.&#160; For ski areas not expected to generate AGR for a given payment cycle, advance payment of the SAPF as calculated in clause VI.B.4 shall be made.&#160; The advance payment shall be credited toward the total SAPF for the payment cycle.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; The holder shall report sales, calculate the SAPF due based on a tentative percentage rate, and make interim payments each calendar month, except for periods in which no sales take place and the holder has notified the authorized officer that the operation has entered a seasonal shutdown for a specific period.&#160; Reports and payments shall be made by the end of the month following the end of each reportable period.&#160; Interim payments shall be credited toward the total SAPF for the payment cycle.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; Within 90 days after the close of the ski area's payment cycle, the holder shall provide a financial statement, including a completed SAPF information form, Form FS-2700-19a, representing the ski area's financial condition at the close of its business year and an annual operating statement reporting the results of operations, including a final payment which includes year-end adjustments for the holder and each subholder for the same period.&#160; Any balance that exists may be credited and applied against the next payment due or refunded, at the discretion of the holder.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160; Within 30 days of receipt of a statement from the Forest Service, the holder shall make any additional payment required to ensure that the correct SAPF is paid for the past year's operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	5.&#160; All SAPF calculations and records of sales are subject to review or periodic audit as determined by the authorized officer.&#160; Errors in calculation or payment shall be corrected as needed for conformance with those reviews or audits.&#160; In accordance with clause VI.E, interest and penalties shall be assessed on additional fees due as a result of reviews or audits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CORRECTION OF ERRORS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Correction of errors includes any action necessary to calculate the holder's sales or slope transport feet percentage or to make any other determination required to calculate SAPFs accurately.&#160; For SAPF calculation purposes, an error may include:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; Misreporting or misrepresentation of amounts;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; Arithmetical mistakes;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; Typographical mistakes; or
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160; Variation from generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), when such variations are inconsistent with the terms of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Correction of errors shall be made retroactively to the date the error was made or to the previous audit period, whichever is more recent, and past SAPFs shall be adjusted accordingly.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	14
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	E.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	FEE PAYMENT ISSUES
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	1.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Crediting of Payments
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Payments shall be credited on the date received by the deposit facility, except that if a payment is received on a non-workday, the payment shall not be credited until the next work day.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	2.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Disputed Fees
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Fees are due and payable by the due date.&#160; Disputed fees must be paid in full.&#160; &#160; Adjustments will be made if dictated by settlement terms or an appeal decision.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	3.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Late Payments
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(a)&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Interes
</U>
</FONT>
	t.&#160; Pursuant to 31 U.S.C. 3717
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	., interest shall be charged on any fee amount not paid within 30 days from the date it became due.&#160; The rate of interest assessed shall be the higher of the Prompt Payment Act rate or the rate of the current value of funds to the Treasury (i.e., the Treasury tax and loan account rate), as prescribed and published annually or quarterly by the Secretary of the Treasury in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Federal Register
</U>
</FONT>
	and the Treasury Fiscal Requirements Manual Bulletins.&#160; Interest on the principal shall accrue from the date the fee amount is due.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(b)&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Administrative Costs
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; If the account becomes delinquent, administrative costs to cover processing and handling the delinquency shall be assessed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(c)&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Penalties
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; A penalty of 6% per annum shall be assessed on the total amount that is more than 90 days delinquent and shall accrue from the same date on which interest charges begin to accrue.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(d)&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Termination for Nonpayment
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; This permit shall terminate without the necessity of prior notice and opportunity to comply when any permit fee payment is 90 calendar days from the due date in arrears. The holder shall be responsible for the delinquent fees, as well as any other costs of restoring the site to its original condition, including hazardous waste cleanup.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	4.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Administrative Offset and Credit Reporting
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; Delinquent fees and other charges associated with the permit shall be subject to all rights and remedies afforded the United States pursuant to 31 U.S.C. 3711
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	. and common law.&#160; Delinquencies are subject to any or all of the following:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(a)&#160; Administrative offset of payments due the holder from the Forest Service.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(b)&#160; If in excess of 60 days, referral to the Department of the Treasury for appropriate collection action as provided by 31 U.S.C. 3711(g)(1).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(c)&#160; Offset by the Secretary of the Treasury of any amount due the holder, as provided by 31 U.S.C. 3720
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	et seq
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	(d)&#160; Disclosure to consumer or commercial credit reporting agencies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ACCESS TO RECORDS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; For the purpose of administering this permit (including ascertaining that the correct land use fee was paid), the holder shall make all accounting books and supporting records for the authorized operations, as well as those of lessees operating in the permit area, available for review by the Forest Service or other federal agencies authorized to review the Forest Service activities.&#160; Review of accounting books and supporting records shall be made at dates convenient to the holder and reviewers.&#160; Financial information so obtained shall be kept confidential to the extent permitted by law.&#160; The holder shall retain these records and keep them available for review for 5 years after they were generated, unless otherwise approved by the authorized officer in writing.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ACCOUNTING RECORDS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The holder shall follow GAAP or other comprehensive bases of accounting acceptable to the Forest Service in recording financial transactions and in reporting results to the authorized officer.&#160; When requested by the authorized officer, the holder at its own expense shall have the annual accounting reports audited or prepared by a licensed independent accountant acceptable to the Forest Service.&#160; The holder shall require lessees to comply with these same requirements.&#160; At a minimum, the holder&#8217;s or lessees&#8217; accounting system shall include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; Systematic internal controls, including recording by type of business the gross receipts derived from all operations conducted under this permit. Gross receipts should be recorded daily and, if possible, deposited into a bank account without reduction by disbursements.&#160; Receipt entries shall be documented by cash-register tapes, sale invoices, rental records, cash accounts from other sources, or some other means.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; A permanent record of capital investments in facilities (including a depreciation schedule).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; Generation and maintenance of such other records and accounts as may be specified by the authorized officer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	15
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	VII.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	REVOCATION, SUSPENSION, AND TERMINATION
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	REVOCATION AND SUSPENSION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The authorized officer may revoke or suspend this permit in whole or in part:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1.&#160; For noncompliance with federal, state, or local law.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2.&#160; For noncompliance with the terms and conditions of this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3.&#160; For abandonment or other failure of the holder to exercise the privileges granted.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4.&#160; With the consent of the holder.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	5.&#160; For specific and compelling reasons in the public interest.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Prior to revocation or suspension, other than immediate suspension under clause VII.C, the authorized officer shall give the holder (and if applicable, the operator) written notice of the grounds for revocation or suspension.&#160; In the case of revocation or suspension based on clause VII.A.1, VII.A.2, or VII.A.3, the authorized officer shall give the holder a reasonable period, not to exceed 90 days, to cure any noncompliance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	REVOCATION FOR SPECIFIC AND COMPELLING REASONS IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST.
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160; The authorized officer may revoke this permit during its term if the Forest Service determines through the process of amending or revising the applicable land management plan that the use and occupancy authorized by this permit should be changed for specific and compelling reasons in the public interest, other than a determination under clause IV.E. that the authorized improvements or the permit area cannot be safely occupied.&#160; Prior to revoking the permit under this clause, the authorized officer shall give the holder 90 days written notice provided that the authorized officer may prescribe a shorter notice period if justified by the public interest.&#160; The Forest Service shall then have the right to purchase the holder&#8217;s authorized improvements, remove them or require the holder to relocate or remove them.&#160; The Forest Service shall be obligated to pay the lesser of (1) the cost of relocation of the authorized improvements and damages resulting from their relocation that are caused by the Forest Service or (2) the value of the authorized improvements as determined by the Forest Service through an appraisal of the market value of the improvements based on the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions (Uniform Standards). Where appropriate under the Uniform Standards, the potential of the improvements to generate income over the remainder of the term of the permit may be considered, but any consideration of future potential for income production shall be limited to the remainder of the permit term. If this amount is fixed by agreement between the authorized officer and the holder, that amount shall be accepted by the holder in full satisfaction of all claims against the United States under this clause.&#160; If agreement is not reached, the authorized officer shall determine the amount to be paid, which shall be set forth in the revocation decision.&#160; A payment made pursuant to this clause is subject to the availability of appropriations.&#160; Nothing in this permit implies that Congress will appropriate funds to cover a deficiency in appropriations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	IMMEDIATE SUSPENSION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The authorized officer may immediately suspend this permit in whole or in part when necessary to protect public health or safety or the environment.&#160; The suspension decision shall be in writing.&#160; The holder may request an on-site review with the authorized officer&#8217;s supervisor of the adverse conditions prompting the suspension.&#160; The authorized officer&#8217;s supervisor shall grant this request within 48 hours.&#160; Following the on-site review, the authorized officer&#8217;s supervisor shall promptly affirm, modify, or cancel the suspension.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	APPEALS AND REMEDIES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	Written decisions made by the authorized officer relating to administration of this permit are subject to administrative appeal pursuant to 36 CFR Part 214.&#160; Revocation or suspension of this permit shall not give rise to any claim for damages by the holder against the Forest Service, other than as provided in clause VII.B.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	TERMINATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	This permit shall terminate when by its terms a fixed or agreed upon condition, event, or time occurs without any action by the authorized officer.&#160; Examples include but are not limited to expiration of the permit by its terms on a specified date and termination upon change of control of the business entity.&#160; Termination of this permit is not subject to administrative appeal and shall not give rise to any claim for damages by the holder against the Forest Service.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES UPON REVOCATION OR TERMINATION WITHOUT RENEWAL
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Except as provided in clause VII.B, upon revocation of this permit or termination of this permit without renewal of the authorized use, the authorized officer has the discretion to require the holder to sell or remove all structures and improvements, except those owned by the United States, within a reasonable period prescribed by the authorized officer and to restore the site to the satisfaction of the authorized officer.&#160; If the holder fails to sell or remove all structures or improvements within the prescribed period, they shall become the property of the United States and may be sold, destroyed, or otherwise disposed of without any liability to the United States.&#160; However, the holder shall remain liable for all costs associated with their removal, including costs of sale and impoundment, cleanup, and restoration of the site.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	16
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	G.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CONTINUATION OF OBLIGATIONS AND LIABILITIES BEYOND EXPIRATION OR REVOCATION
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; Notwithstanding the termination or revocation of this permit, its terms and conditions shall remain in effect and shall be binding on the holder and the holder&#8217;s personal representative, successors, and assignees until all the holder&#8217;s obligations and liabilities accruing before or as a result of termination or revocation of this permit have been satisfied.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	VIII.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS
</U>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	MEMBERS OF CONGRESS
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; No member of or delegate to Congress or Resident Commissioner shall benefit from this permit either directly or indirectly, except to the extent the authorized use provides a general benefit to a corporation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	REGULATING SERVICES AND RATES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; The authorized officer shall have the authority to regulate the adequacy and type of services provided the public under this permit and to require that these services conform to satisfactory standards.&#160; The holder may be required to furnish a schedule of prices for sales and services authorized by the permit.&#160; These prices may be regulated by the authorized officer, provided that the holder shall not be required to charge prices significantly different from those charged by comparable or competing enterprises.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	ADVERTISING
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	The holder, either orally or in advertisements, signs, circulars, brochures, letterheads, and like materials, shall not misrepresent in any way the accommodations provided, the status of the permit, or the ownership of the permit area or adjacent lands.&#160; The fact that the authorized facilities and services are located on the Arapaho National Forest shall be explicitly stated in all the holder's brochures and print advertising regarding the operations authorized by this permit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	CURRENT ADDRESSES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The holder and the authorized officer shall keep each other informed of current mailing addresses, including those necessary for billing and payment of land use fees.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SUPERSEDED PERMIT
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
	&#160; This permit supersedes a special use permit designated City and County of Denver Winter Park Recreational Association, as Agent, SUL101901 and SUL101902, dated 12/8/1983.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	SUPERIOR CLAUSES
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	If there is a conflict between any of the preceding printed clauses and any of the following clauses, the preceding printed clauses shall control.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	G. NOXIOUS WEED/EXOTIC PLANT PREVENTION AND CONTROL.
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1. The holder shall be responsible for the prevention and control of noxious weeds and/or exotic plants of concern on the area authorized by this authorization and shall provide prevention and control measures prescribed by the Forest Service. Noxious weeds and exotic plants of concern are defined as those species recognized by the Arapaho-Roosevelt National Forests in which the authorized use is located.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2. When determined to be necessary by the authorized officer, the holder shall develop a site-specific plan for noxious weed and exotic plant prevention and control. Such plan shall be subject to Forest Service approval. Upon Forest Service approval, the noxious weed and exotic plant prevention and control plan shall become a part of this authorization, and its provisions shall be enforceable under the terms of this authorization.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3. The holder shall also be responsible for prevention and control of noxious weed and exotic plant infestations which are not within the authorized area, but which are determined by the Forest Service to have originated within the authorized area
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	17
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	THIS PERMIT IS ACCEPTED SUBJECT TO ALL ITS TERMS AND CONDITIONS.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	BEFORE ANY PERMIT IS ISSUED TO AN ENTITY, DOCUMENTATION MUST BE PROVIDED TO THE AUTHORIZED OFFICER OF THE AUTHORITY OF THE SIGNATORY FOR THE ENTITY TO BIND IT TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PERMIT.
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	25
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	gpm
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 20%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Potable Supply
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	* The aggregate decreed capacity of the snowmaking system is 7
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	cfs
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	This amendment is attached to and made a part of the Ski Area Term special use authorization for operating, maintaining, and constructing, as defined in the Master development Plan, a four-season resort issued to WINTER PARK RECREATIONAL ASSOC on 04/29/2016 which is hereby amended as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IV. E.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	RISK OF LOSS
</U>
</FONT>
	.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Shall be replaced with the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_78"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IV. E.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	RISKS
</U>
</FONT>
	.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The holder assumes all risk of loss to the improvements resulting from natural or catastrophic events, including but not limited to, avalanches, rising waters, high winds, falling limbs or trees, and other hazardous events. If the improvements authorized by this permit are destroyed or substantially damaged by natural or catastrophic events, the authorized officer shall conduct an analysis to determine whether the improvements can be safely occupied in the future and whether rebuilding should be allowed. The analysis shall be provided to the holder within six (6) months of the event.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
